item.title: SF official calls to diversify COVID testing after system failure shut down Bay Area sites
item.description: "We should always have contracts with more than one provider. So, when something like this happens, and someone's system goes down, we are not affected as a city."
item.dc:creator: Luz Pena
item.media:title: Color outage highlights need to demonopolize COVID testing
item.media:description: COVID-19 cases are surging in California. What's making matters worse, is the system outage by Color Health, which impacted several Bay Area cities.

item.title: Hayward Unified School District risks $2.5M in funds daily by going virtual temporarily
item.description: "Obviously we know the impact of losing money," Schafer Park Elementary School parent Rochelle Balthazar said. "But was it effective to stay open with so little kids on campus, possibly without a teacher?"
item.dc:creator: Dustin Dorsey
item.media:title: Hayward Unified schools risk millions in funding by going virtual
item.media:description: Hayward Unified School District students and staff returned to virtual learning Tuesday despite guidance from the state and the county.

item.title: Omicron will 'find just about everybody' but vaccinated will still fare better, Fauci says
item.description: On Tuesday, the number of U.S. patients hospitalized with COVID-19 hit a record high, adding strain to health care networks and pushing states toward emergency staffing and other measures as they struggle to cope.
item.dc:creator: CNNWire
item.media:title: Omicron will 'find just about everybody,' Fauci says
item.media:description: As the omicron variant spreads like wildfire across the United States, it's likely just about everybody will be exposed to the strain.

item.title: Red Cross declares national blood crisis as donations plummet during on-going pandemic
item.description: A spokesperson put the crisis into perspective, explaining that while every 2 seconds someone in the U.S. needs blood, the Red Cross only has a 1-day supply to work with.
item.dc:creator: KGO
item.media:title: Down to 1-day blood supply, Red Cross declares national crisis
item.media:description: Not only are we dealing with a pandemic, but the American Red Cross says we're in a blood crisis that may put patients at risk.
item.media:keywords: american red cross, red cross donate blood, red cross blood donation, red cross donation, red cross national blood crisis, red cross blood shortage, red cross blood supply,
item.category: Health & Fitness,San Francisco,blood donations,american red cross,Coronavirus,coronavirus pandemic,u.s. & world,red cross

item.title: Allies in action: Local help with complicated issues

item.title: Indiana man arrested in Young Dolph's death; 2nd man charged
item.description: A Tennessee man wanted in the fatal shooting of rapper Young Dolph in his hometown of Memphis was captured Tuesday in Indiana, while another man was indicted on murder charges, authorities said.

item.title: California makes it easier to hire teachers amid shortages brought by latest COVID surge
item.description: Newsom said he hopes to expedite a hiring process that's typically time consuming and allow school districts "to keep our kids safely in person for the remainder of the year and get through this next three to six or so weeks."
